intro: Eschscholzia hypecoides, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange or red petals and yellow center, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branched. Eschscholzia hypecoides is an annual herb that thrives in full sunlight and well-drained soil.
